intro: Elatostema nianbense, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant features small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Elatostema nianbense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops.
